720409f-a.text:
Hester Street, north side, east from Essex to Suffolk Streets. Note the flag of P.S. No. 75 (Norfolk Street, west side, north of Hester) across the roofs. To-day (1937) this has been replaced by P.S. No. 62, which also occupies the sites of buildings in the foreground. No. 41 Hester Street,
is a 3-story frame house with a brick front.
About 1905.
Ewing Galloway.
720409f-a.folder: Hester Street & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY

720410f-a.text:
Hester Street, north side, east from Essex to Suffolk Streets. Note No. 41; a 3-story frame house with a brick front. Buildings between Essex and Norfolk Streets, have been replaced by P.S. No. 62.
About 1905.
Ewing Galloway.
N4( ~R953
720410f-a.folder: Hester Street & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY

719649f-a.text:
31 to 1 Essex Street, west side, from north of Hester to and including Canal Streets. The view also shows 2-16 Rutgers Street, west side, from Canal to Henry Streets. The St. Teresa Roman Catholic Church is in the background in Henry Street. The view also shows 163-175 East Broadway, at, adjoinAng and east of the S.E. corner of Rutgers Street.
April so, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.
719649f-a.folder: Essex Street & Hester Street, Manhattan, NY

720408f-b.text:
(1)
Hester Street, (running from fore to background), east from Essex, to Clinton Streets, showing (right), a portion of Seward Park and (left), the playground pf P.S. No. 62. Also shown are Nos. 18 to 30 Norfolk Street, at adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Hester Street. The 2-story building at the corner, is the Hester Street branch of the N.Y. Edison Co.
April 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another angle.
About 1936
Gift of Dr. Michael aishengrad A.R.P.S.
720408f-b.folder: Hester Street & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY
